group_1.narration: Whoopsies, I better back up and explain that@my dream actually used to be different.
When I was in seventh grade, I really,@really wanted to be a volleyball player!
Ya can't exactly picture that, can you,@peeking a look at how I am now...@But the true truth is...

group_1.textRight: Hello! I'm here for Ikumi!

group_1.textLeft: Did you come by because you heard she's@feeling down?

group_1.textRight: Yes! Getting out of the house is best at@times like these!

group_1.textLeft: Thank you.
She's trying her hardest, but that girl was@never great at sports...
Please help take her mind off of things.

group_1.narration: I couldn't get the darn hang of volleyball…
I tried really extra hard, but never got better.@It was a suuuper stressful time for me.

group_1.textLeft: I got dressed... Does it look weird on me?

group_1.textRight: You're adorable no matter what you wear! You@look great!

group_1.textLeft: You think so? I feel like it's too cute for@me...

group_1.textRight: [chara:800203:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]All right, let's gooo! We're going shopping!

group_1.narration: "When you're feeling low,@getting dressed up and going out is best!"
That's what Yumi would say@whenever I was feeling sad.@She was always there for me.

group_1.textLeft: Um... Don't you think this accessory is too@flashy?

group_1.textRight: It suits you, Ikumi! It's super cute! Stop@worrying!

group_1.narration: Yumi was reeeally tall, even back then,@so when we were together...

group_1.textRight: Hey, Ikumi! What's up?

group_1.textLeft: Ahh! You startled me... [chara:305301:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:305301:cheek_0][chara:305301:face_mtn_ex_010.exp.json][chara:305301:lipSynch_1]Are you doing extra@practice on your own?

group_1.textRight: You got it.
Is she your friend?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, we're on the same volleyball team.

group_1.textRight: Nice to meet you. Are you Ikumi's older@sister?

group_1.textLeft: No, no. We just grew up together.

group_1.textRight: [chara:800101:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What?! Seriously?! I thought you were way@older!

group_1.narration: This kinda happened a lot. Most people@usually thought I was younger than her.

group_1.textRight: I was gonna ask if you wanted to practice @too, but maybe you aren't dressed for it...

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... I'd like to practice with you, but...
Hey, I know. [chara:305301:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:305301:cheek_0][chara:305301:face_mtn_ex_010.exp.json][chara:305301:lipSynch_1]Yumi, want to give it a shot?

group_1.textRight: Me? Okay, but are you sure I won't get @in the way?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah. You're athletic, aren't you? I could@learn a thing or two from you.

group_1.narration: They paired off, and practiced@attacking and receiving.@Yumi had trouble at first, but then...

group_1.textRight: This one will be harder... Get ready!

group_1.narration: *SLAM*

group_1.textLeft: [bgEffect:shakeSmall]This one's mine!

group_1.textCenter: (I could never do that... Maybe I just don't@have the talent, like she does...)

group_1.narration: Before I knew it,@she was receiving strong spikes,@and she could even send the@ball back by copying our attack hits.

group_1.textRight: You're coming to our school next year,@right? Want to join the volleyball team?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... I don't know... I want to become an@idol.
That's your dream, after all.
Yeah...

group_1.textRight: I see... That's too bad.
But now it makes sense. No wonder you're@so good at singing, Ikumi.

group_1.textLeft: Huh? I am?

group_1.textRight: You blew me away when we went to karaoke@together!
You sang a song by an idol that my mom used@to really like... I forget the name.
Did you two practice singing together?

group_1.narration: She was talking about songs that@Yumi loved, and that I started loving, too.
They were songs by idols@that our mothers used to love!
Songs from our older gen— Ah, um, I mean,@when our still super young moms were teens!
Those extra-cute as a button pop stars@who sing and dance and SPARKLE on stage,@capturing the hearts of their audience.@We couldn't get enough of 'em!

group_1.textRight: You're really good, Ikumi... Both at singing@and dancing...

group_1.textLeft: But you're working so hard in your lessons!
You'll be better than me in no time.

group_1.textRight: Well... I have been practicing...
[chara:800203:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]But they told me I sound like a howling dog,@and I look like a jellyfish when I dance.

group_1.textLeft: (I kind of get what she means...)

group_1.narration: While I worried about my volleyball skills,@Yumi worried about her singing and dancing.
We worried our dreams wouldn't come true,@even after working really hard towards them.

group_1.textRight: So basically, Ikumi wants to be a volleyball@player, but isn't good at sports.
And Yumi wants to become an idol, even@though she's not good at singing?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah... Pretty ironic, right...
It'd be easy for our dreams to come true if@I was Yumi, and if Yumi was me...

group_1.textRight: If I were you...

group_1.textLeft: (Yeah...our dreams would come true if they@were switched...)

group_1.textRight: Oh! I need to go home. I'll get in trouble@for not helping with dinner!
See you at our next practice, Ikumi! It was@nice meeting you, Yumi!

group_1.narration: The words I uttered so thoughtlessly @felt kind of right to me, surprisingly.
Yumi seemed to feel the same way.

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Yumi.

group_1.textRight: Yeah?

group_1.textLeft: I want to achieve your dream for you, by@becoming an idol.

group_1.textRight: And I'll make your dream come true by@becoming a volleyball player.

group_1.narration: The two of us had two different dreams.@We'd have trouble achieving them ourselves,@but if we entrusted them to one another,@we'd achieve both dreams, as best friends.
So we decided on it, together.@Neither of us had second thoughts,@and I'm still glad we went through with it.
Huh? I'm talking out of character?
Eeek! @A-anyway, I decided that I just@HAD to be an idol, and...

group_1.textRight: I'd really like... I wanna become an idol@really, really bad!
Pretty please, may I transfer to a school@where I can learn how to be up on stage?

group_1.narration: I asked my mom and dad, and they let me switch@to a different school for performing arts!
